node.title: US white supremacists targeting under-vaxxed Aboriginal communities, WA Premier says
node.alt: A close up of Mark McGowan wearing a blue suit and red tie, with a stern expression on his face.
node.description: Mark McGowan says American hate groups are specifically targeting remote Aboriginal communities by spreading misinformation about COVID-19 vaccinations.
node.content:
["Premier Mark McGowan says United States-based white supremacist groups are spreading misinformation online to cause fear about COVID-19 vaccinations in remote Aboriginal communities in Western Australia.", "Mr McGowan made the comments during a press conference in Kalgoorlie today and again warned that travel to regional communities could be restricted after WA's border reopens if they do not reach vaccination targets.", "\"There's been some misinformation provided to Aboriginal people from people who do not have their best interests at heart,\" he said.", "\"Now, the suspicion is these white supremacist\u00a0groups out of America wouldn't be unhappy\u00a0if bad outcomes occurred to the health of Aboriginal people in Australia.", "\"That's the problem we face.\"", "
Low rates, ill intent
", "Mr McGowan said the Goldfields, Pilbara and Kimberley remained particular areas of concern because of their low vaccination\u00a0rates.", "With only 13 per cent of its Aboriginal population fully vaccinated, the\u00a0northern Goldfields town of Leonora has one of the lowest rates in the state.", "The Premier said the government must \"combat\" misinformation and would continue its regional vaccination blitz in the push to reach the reopening target of 90 per cent fully vaccinated.", "\"Some of these groups, like white supremacist groups,\u00a0are doing it because they want to harm Aboriginal people,\" Mr McGowan\u00a0said.\u00a0", "", "
Vaccine commander Chris Dawson meeting with elder Nyari Nyari at Parnngurr in November 2021.(ABC News: Verity Gorman)
", "
Foreign threat
", "The Aboriginal strategic advisor to the Vaccine Commander, Wanita Bartholomeusz, said the misinformation being spread online was \"extremely dangerous\" and \"very concerning\".\u00a0", "She said Facebook groups, such as Freedom Keepers, which has a cover\u00a0photograph of Donald Trump holding a machine gun in front of an American flag, had been active on social media in remote WA communities.", "\"This is not a militia for right wing people with boom sticks,\" the cover page of the private\u00a0page reads, accompanied by a\u00a0winking face emoji.", "", "
WA authorities say the private Freedom Keepers Facebook account has been actively spreading misinformation in Aboriginal communities.(Facebook)
", "Ms Bartholomeusz said the spread of misinformation online had\u00a0presented a constant challenge for health authorities during the pandemic.\u00a0", "\"We've found individuals up in Queensland with faith-based views and they've been putting their information through to Aboriginal networks,\" she said.", "\"Through a number of different sources we've\u00a0been able to see that they link back to faith-based organisations in the US.", "\"The concern is that Aboriginal people are being targeted and, we believe, other persons of colour around the world, using their mission and Christian ideology to perpetuate false information about the COVID vaccine.\""]
